book.title: Book Name: In Search of Lost Time
book.author: Author: Marcel Proust
book.preface: Preface: this book is prefaced by a quotation from william faulkner

chapter.title: Chapter 1
chapter.summary: Summary:the first part of A la recherche de temps perdu, Marcel Proust's seven-part cycle

section.content: Content:Proust introduces the themes that run through the entire work. The narr...
The novel deals with the subjective nature of experiencing reality
Proust remains unmatched in the obsession and attention to detail with which he illuminated every single aspect of human existence.
This makes for a lengthy voyage, and you are likely to run out of steam at times.

chapter.title: Chapter 3
chapter.summary: He frets about the reasons for Albertine’s flight and tries to get her back with the help of crafty stratagems

section.content: Just as Marcel starts to forget Albertine, Andrée confides more secrets to him
The once romantic Saint-Loup marries the wealthy Gilberte for want of money and turns out to be a closet homosexual.

chapter.title: Chapter 4
chapter.summary: Marcel spends several years in a sanatorium before returning to Paris at the beginning of 1916.

section.content: The war has altered the city and its inhabitants beyond recognition.
That same night Marcel survives a terrible air raid, and a few days later he learns that Saint-Loup has died in combat.
